name: Hampton Inn Seattle Airport

reviews.title: OK for a stopover
reviews.text: No problems here. It's not a place that I'd want to book for more than a layover between flights out of SeaTac, but for that purpose it was fine.

Comfy pillowtop mattress and new bedding. Clean. Stayed 2 nights and no issues with airport noise even though next to SEA-TAC taxiways. My only complaint is the bath countertop is small and designed for very short people. Bonus is the window on 3rd floor opened for fresh air. Reliable Hilton high-speed internet.
reviews.title: I will return

likes.liked: — Location halfway between Issaquah and Tacoma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Neighborhood is a little dicey for solo female diner but a short drive to Redondo Beach for dinner at Salty's solved the problem. Front desk made reservation and provided driving directions. Redondo Beach beachside boardwalk is popular with walkers of all ages. Salty's also has an oudoor carry-out window for budget diners.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel close to the airport. Our room was on the top floor and was a non-smoking room that was still a little stuffy (smokey?). I stayed at this location about 8 years ago for the first time. Overall, this hotel has been well managed/maintained over the past years. I would recommend it if you have a late arrival or early departure. It also has a nice breakfast
reviews.title: Clean comfortable room

reviews.text: Interesting how people can have such different experiences. I stayed there last week prior to flying out and I thought the hotel was above average. No trouble at all with shuttle, the front desk staff was very accomodating in taking you to local restaurants. They even called restaurants for several folks and made reservations for them. Had problem with lobby computer in printing boarding pass, so desk clerk used the hotel computer to complete it for me. I didn't see any problems with security, although there must be some because back lot is closed in with barbed wire chain link fence. Seatac area is iffy, I wouldn't walk anywhere at any time of day. I would either stay at this Hampton or the Sleep Inn, which also has had problems with car breakins. Seems as if lesson is to leave nothing in car, which is what I do when in Seatac, I put everything in trunk.
reviews.title: Fair room quality, unfriendly staff

likes.liked: — That I was there only 1 nite

reviews.title: I think it was a fluke but,
reviews.text: Upon entry I saw the bathroom garbage full & a dirty towel thrown over the shower curtain. Then I noted spider webs and dust every where, no coffee for the coffee pot &, later, a huge puddle of water under the heater/ac...... the husband went out and informed the desk clerk of the water problem, resulting in the clerk saying he would be right in-- I finally went out to find the clerk to see where he was, after waiting for over an hour for him. The lady clerk said "oh, he went home, that is always wet and we don't know why it's wet". Then the icing on the cake ...no sheets on the bed!! I saw in the am that the window was leaking FYI.
It was the last room, so we stayed---I do not think it is the norm for Hampton--but it was an interesting stay, to say the least!!
reviews.title: Best Hamption Inn I have stayed at

reviews.text: My wife and I spent one night at the inn prior to our flight out the next morning. This is the best Hampton Inn I have ever stayed out. The rooms were perfect. The breakfast in the morning was just great. Free wireless Internet to boot. There was free shuttle to and from the airport every 10-15 minutes. Give this hotel a chance.
reviews.title: Great Value & Location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn following our Alaska cruise. We wanted to tour the Boeing plant. My wife made a reservation with a local tour business that botched the reservation. We told the front desk manager, Mirsela, who immediately called an alternative tour company and booked us right away.
reviews.title: The only good thing was the housekeeper!

reviews.text: John and Tim the shuttle drivers drove us to the airport and restaurants and gave us the lay of the land. They went out of their way to make us feel right at home.
reviews.title: Give it a pass until the fall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was much better than the typical "continental" at most chains. The breakfast room is set lower and away from the desk traffic and is pleasingly furnished with landscape views from the windows. There was a hotel employee continually cleaning and refilling the available items, and who also would discreetly handle obnoxious or unruly guests. They offered sausage, eggs, English muffins, biscuits, bagels, yogurt, cerealas, toaster waffles, fresh fruit, juices, and a choice of three coffee brews. Copies of USA Today are available for your morning read.
reviews.title: Breakfast a cut above

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was helpful, even though they were busy. They procured an inexpensive cab for us in under ten minutes and were prompt with their airport shuttle.
reviews.title: As usual, the best!!
Not as good as other Hampton Inns
reviews.text: The room was clean, well furnished, and the bed was extremely comfortable.
I was concerned about the reviews regarding jet or traffic noise, but could not detect any such noise from my room. With the air conditioner running, I could not hear any outside noises.
reviews.title: Duck and Cover! Here comes another jet through the room!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The price for all of this was less than you would pay for comparable chain hotels.
reviews.title: Great Seattle Welcome at the Hampton Inn Sea-Tac

reviews.text: Nice hotel to rest at for a layover, not far from aiport. Had a nice pool to relax in. Had no complaints.
reviews.title: Nice layover hotel

reviews.text: I arrived from the East Coast and was unable to continue my onward travel same day, so I stayed at this inexpensive airport location. It's so close that the airport shuttle arrives very quickly after contacting the hotel on the free phone.
reviews.title: Perfect for airport convenience

reviews.text: I was a little nervous when I saw that my room was next to the fitness center, but no one was being ambitious enough to exercise; so I had a quiet stay.
reviews.title: Not very quiet, but ok

reviews.text: If you simply need a place to sleep near the airport, this hotel is just fine.
reviews.title: Great Stay/Value for an Airport Hotel

likes.liked: — Continental Breakfast; Comfort and Cleanliness of Room; Proximity to Airport
likes.disliked: — You're not going for a stroll - industrial area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights because it was convenient to be close to the airport. The hotel claims to be one of the quietest near the airport, but I can't imagine how this is possible. The first night I heard every plane and car go by, and the people in the room next door. But on the bright side, the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. We didn't try the free breakfast, but it looked like they had a lot of good stuff. I peeked into the fitness room, it was very tiny with one treadmill, one bike, one elliptical, and some weights.
reviews.title: Yes, we will return too

aka: Hampton Inn Seattle Airport Hotel Seattle
